I was thinking about reputation, and how people get it, so I created this list of the 5 major ways to get reputation:

The Spacecraft exchange way - AKA The Majorjim way:

Basically, just releasing awesome craft in The Spacecraft Exchange.

The General KSP discussion way - AKA The Regex way:

Having strong opinions, which are shared by other people, and making funny, tongue in cheek posts.

The Fan Works way - AKA The 5thHorseman way:

Awesome video series, and/or other art/music.

The Modding way - AKA the Ferram4 way:

Awesome mods!

The Magic way - AKA the Squad way:

Magic.

The Gameplay Questions way - AKA The NathanKell way: Helping people get better at KSP.

The Moderator way - AKA The Moderator way: Making calming posts in contentious threads and locking those that are just flamewars. (Seriously, people rep for this sort of thing) (They should more-ED)

The hardest part of writing this post was choosing who to use as an example. Thanks for reading!

True, however I count that as the spacecraft exchange way.

Some others I've experienced:

**The Gameplay Questions way:**

Helping people get better at KSP.

**The Moderator way:**

Making calming posts in contentious threads and locking those that are just flamewars. (Seriously, people rep for this sort of thing)

Though if I'm honest most of mine comes from the General Discussion way.

> 
> That makes sense, but what about mod-makers? Maybe it's that mods get just as much rep as crafts, but since they aren't new ones constantly, they don't get as much rep.

Mods have a degree of delay of gratification that makes for less rep. A craft, picture or wisecrack can be immediately appreciated, while a mod requires the player to install and use it for a while before knowing whether it is good or not, and then remember to come back and rep the modder. It's a bit unfair in that the reputation system doesn't seem to reward modders who contribute so much to the community (with a few exceptions), though most of the modders I've interacted with don't care about forum reputation at all.

I actually tend to feel really bad when people rep me for closing a contentious thread - I'm just doing my job ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) - and I'd prefer not to be closing the thread.
